metadata.Title: CVE-2023-4527 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in glibc. When the getaddrinfo function is called with the AF_UNSPEC address family and the system is configured with no-aaaa mode via /etc/resolv.conf, a DNS response via TCP larger than 2048 bytes can potentially disclose stack contents through the function returned address data, and may cause a crash.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> no-aaaa was introduced in 2.36 by: https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commitdiff;h=f282cdbe7f436c75864e5640a409a10485e9abb2 system needs to be configured in no-aaaa mode in resolv.conf

criterions.comment: glibc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
